required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Thoracic Spine Manipulation for Patients With Thoracic Spine Pain
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Manipulation for Thoracic Spine Pain and Mobility, and Reliability of Used Mobility Measurements.

brief_summary.textblock:
The study includes two phases. In phase one the reliability of thoracic spine mobility measurements are studied in subjects with thoracic spine pain. In phase two the reliable measurements are used to measure the effects of thoracic spine manipulation in subjects with thoracic spine pain. The changes in pain is measured as well.
In second phase the control group receives TNS treatment six times at home as a placebo so that the power of TNS is limited to very low level. The number of treatments are controlled as well as the time of treatment. The treatment group receives six manipulation treatments within 3 week period. The effects are measured immediately after the treatment weeks, and 3 and 8 week follow-up. Moreover the one year follow-up will be performed by mail questionnaire.

detailed_description.textblock: Outcome measures are intensity of pain (VAS, Roland-Morris questionnaire) thoracic mobility (measured with computer, tape measurements, inclinometer and manually).

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Thoracic spine mobility (computer controllod spine PA measurement, tape measurements, inclinometer)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, after treatment, 3, 8, and 49 week follow-up

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, after treatment, 3, 8 and 49 week follow-up

arm_group.description: Subjects will receive 6 manipulation treatments within 3 weeks period. The manipulated segments are determined individually in baseline assessment.
6 TNS treatments at home for 20min in limited power of devices in three weeks period.

intervention.intervention_name: Manipulation of thoracic spine compared to sham TNS treatment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Thoracic spine pain,
- 18-55 years old
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inflammatory spine disease,
- previous surgery on thoracic spine area,
- osteoporosis
